title: The Friendly Jukebox, Sangean WR22
text:
Home > Gadgets > The Friendly Jukebox, Sangean WR22 The Friendly Jukebox, Sangean WR22 / 
You know how sometimes we get some uncommon products, like the Bosch measurement machine we got awhile back. This time, we’ve got digital receiver called the Sangean WR-22. 
Vintage Looks 
Once pulled out of the simple box, I found a hefty machine with a pseudo-wood finishing. This gives it a slightly vintage look that is pleasant to look at. 
Bells and Whistles 
What’s great about the WR-22 is that it can be used as more than just a FM radio. It also functions as a speaker, allowing you to connect digital devices or hardware, like a PC or MP3, to it via Bluetooth, Aux In, and USB. In practice, the Bluetooth works best with smartphones, but I’m not too sure about MP3 players since we didn’t have any at hand. However, I’m quite sure you can use the Aux In or USB input for that. 
Underwhelming Sound 
While the features are nice, the WR-22’s audio quality left much to be desired. There was no way for tweak the sound signature using EQs either, so that’s another demerit. Max volume is decent, but besides that there isn’t much else that makes it sound good. All in all, good connectivity, but sub-par audio.
